alert.note: Alert for Coosa; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 3:25PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Tallapoosa and east central Coosa Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 325 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of New Site to near Wind Creek State Park. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Alexander City, Dadeville, Camp Hill, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Hillabee Creek, Eastern Lake Martin, Northern Lake Martin, Highway 9 and Highway 22, Wind Creek State Park, Still Waters Resort, Western Lake Martin, Southern Lake Martin, Daviston, Fishpond, Susannah Crossing, Maxwell Gunter Recreation Area, Blue Creek Marina, Ray and Horseshoe Bend National Military Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
